summary: Texas is a big state in the southern U.S. It's known as the "Lone Star State" because it was once its own country. Texas has lots of different landscapes, from beaches to deserts. It's also an important state for business, with many big companies based there. The economy is strong because of oil, technology, and other industries. Texas was first controlled by Spain, then Mexico, and became part of the U.S. in 1845. It's the second-largest state by size and population, with over 30 million people as of 2023.
title: Texas
